address: J N R 8 Youth & Community Centre, Manchester, Greater Manchester M16 0BG
description: Whalley Range Community Forum and Manley Park Methodist Church welcome you to our community warm hub on Fridays from 10.00 - 13.00. JNR8 (pronounced generate) is a warm and welcoming space for our community to meet with others, have a cuppa and a crumpet/piece of toast, fruit - and soup and a roll when the weather gets colder! Bring a friend along - or come along on your own and make new friends! We have board games and art materials - or bring your own knitting/craft project along to work on - or you can just sit and read a book. We are a foodbank partner so can help those in food poverty with a foodbank voucher. We often have free bags of essentials such as toiletries and household cleaning products to give away - and a free pre-loved clothes rail to look through. (Also limited SIM cards with free calls and data: ask Chris for details) We invite guests such as Citizens Advice, Scam Awareness, local PCSO's and Councillors - to help with any issues you may have. We can also signpost you to services that might be able to help you if you are struggling. Come and join us at the JNR8 Community Hub for a warm welcome! (the centre is open throughout the week with a range of activities: pop in to check our timetable)
title: JNR8 Youth & Community Centre and Manley Park Methodist church

address: Canklow Pavillion, South Yorkshire S60 2JH
description: RotherFed are offering new community-based drop-in session through the Open Arms Community Support Hubs. A range of local voluntary and community groups, including RotherFed, Citizens Advice Rotherham & District, LASER Credit Union, and Voluntary Action Rotherham, have partnered to develop and deliver a co-ordinated response to support communities most affected by the cost of living crisis. RotherFed’s Community Engagement team and advisers will deliver information, advice and guidance at venues across the borough, right in the heart of the community. Residents will be able to access support with a strong focus on financial and social inclusion, empowering communities with a foundation of support, and making better use of community assets. Each hub will have a drop-in session throughout the day every fortnight. The session at Canklow will run on Wednesdays between 9.30am-3.30pm on a fortnightly basis. The project has been made possible by the UK Shared Prosperity Fund, part of the national government’s Levelling Up agenda, which was successfully secured by Rotherham Council and South Yorkshire Mayoral Combined Authority.
title: Open Arms Community Support Hub - Canklow

address: All Souls - Bolton,, Bolton, England BL1 8EY
description: All Souls is a beautiful historic church that has been converted for use as a conference, office, learning and community space. As part of this work, the original building was carefully restored. Renovation work began in September 2013 and was completed during November 2014. Established by the Greenhalgh brothers in 1881 for the wellbeing of the surrounding community, All Souls will now extend this welcome to a new generation, offering the latest facilities combined with the warm professionalism of our team. All Souls’ place at the heart of the Crompton community makes it the ideal base for local services, activities and events. Its unique beauty makes it a fine place to gain a greater understanding of the heritage of the church and its surroundings. All Souls is open Monday to Friday from 9am till 5pm. Occasionally for events we are open in the evenings and at weekends. All Souls - Bolton is managed by The Churches Conservation Trust, which is a national charity caring for over 350 historic churches in England.

description: Everyone is welcome to join us at the Station Master's House on the first floor of our library every Thursday between 10 and 4 pm from October 2023 until then end of March 2024. We have a warm welcoming space with access to all through a fully accessible lift. Each Thursday we put on different events for example, quizzes, board games, newspapers and magazines with hot refreshments and snacks. We invite local partners to join us to provide practical advise or potential support (dependent on the topic). We also have wifi and free use of six computers and volunteers to help. Last year strangers became friends and we hope very much that this year we will make even more friends. Everyone is very very welcome.

description: We will offer the Warm Space to the local community, called advertised as ‘Welcome Space’. There will be hot drinks served and a selection of cakes and biscuits. There will be an activity offered such as knitting; Christmas craft; other seasonal craft; visitors talk from the community i.e.: LEAP (Warm Funding) CAP Christians against poverty. Toilet facilities are also available to attendees, including disabled access and nappy changing. Pre-school children will be welcome to this event, and activities can be provided if necessary. This will be advertised in the local supermarkets, schools and community library and Fazakerley Federation. It will also be communicated to the housing association Cobalt who are a strong presence in this area.

address: Welland Parish Hall, Gloucester Road, Welland, Malvern, Worcestershire WR13 6LA
description: A place to meet up with friends, and also access useful services including Worcestershire Libraries, is located in Welland Village Hall. Serving people in Welland and the surrounding villages including the Hanleys, Welland's Social Space and Library offers a lovely space to meet up with friends for a coffee, and also to access important services without having to travel to Malvern or Upton. On offer all year round is a "Help yourself" table of hot & cold drinks & biscuits, free high speed wifi, popular "Magazine Swap" table, kids colouring activities, lego and board games, and access to most of Worcestershire library's services (you can even return books that you have borrowed from any of the other libraries in Worcestershire). In addition, through the year, there is a programme of special events, including activities and competitions for children, and also valuable opportunities to access useful services right here within the village, such as those provided by Citizen's Advice, Age UK and West Mercia Police. Information about these will be available on the Parish Council website's News page and its Facebook site as well as on posters on the village hall and village notice board next to the shop. All are welcome at Welland Social Space and Library - you don't have to be a member of the library to come along. Dogs on leads also welcome. Open weekly M 2.30-4.30pm, W 8.30-10.30am, Th 10am-12pm & monthly 10am-12pm on 3rd Sat. Closed Bank Hols & Christmas week. Worcs library services available, also hot & cold drinks, cake/biscuits, kids colouring activities, & free magazine swap table.
title: Welland Social Space and Library

description: Port Gala Team Winter Warmer Hub! EVERY WEDNESDAY 3.30pm-5.30pm Everyone, including children are welcome! You don’t need any particular reason to go other than fancying some food, some company and a bit of warmth. You’ll be welcome to sit in the heated space and meet other villagers to have a chat or you can play board games, read, use the wi-fi or just sit by yourself and enjoy the soup. If they have surplus soup that week, you can take it home if you bring a container.

They also have 10 other interest groups to tap into during the week and are adding to them all the time including more evening and weekend activities too. They have organised outings and several festive celebrations for the coming months so there’s plenty to look forward to during bleak times. If anyone is interested in joining, they can pop into the Active Ageing Centre and find out how to get involved!

If anyone needs any advice or emergency food parcels, they are able to assist with this and if they can’t help for any reason, they know other agencies who can!

description: MS Centre Mid-Argyll The Multiple Sclerosis Centre in Lochgilphead are offering the local community a Warm Space to meet during the Winter months every Monday from 7th November 12pm to 2pm. They will provide a warm friendly welcome, a cup of soup, hot drinks and other refreshments, free Wifi and charging points. There will be no charge to anyone who uses the Warm Space. They would be most grateful, however, if you are in the position to be able to help them help others by contributing to their Warm Space fund. During the Warm Space sessions they aim to have a "Coorie Cupboard" containing fleeces, socks, gloves and other warm items available free of charge too.

Fridays, 10.30-12.00 (second Friday of the month; starting on 11th August) Alzheimer’s Society ‘Singing for the Brain’ and Dementia Adviser support and advice. Fridays, 14.00-15.30 BIPC – one to one business and intellectual property advice sessions. Saturdays, 14.30-16.30 Instilling Brilliance – anger management sessions for 14–16-year-olds.    One-Off/Special Events: Saturday 24th June, 11.00-13.00 Windrush 75 Celebration. Saturday 8th July, annual Summer Reading Challenge for children begins. Saturday 12th August, 11.00-12.30 BCAT (Birmingham Centre for Art Therapies) Summer Reading Challenge (SRC) workshop. Saturday 26th August, 11.00-12.30 BCAT SRC workshop. Friday 1st September – Thursday 30th November, ‘Life of a People’ photographic exhibition. Saturday 23rd September, 14.30-15.45 SRC awards ceremony and ‘Juggling Jim Circus Show’. October, Black History Month food-tasting event (date/time TBC). Thursday 5th October, National Poetry Day poetry performance (date/time TBC). October-December, Ikon Gallery photographic exhibition.

address: Emmaus Shop, Caroline Street, Bridgend, CF31 1DQ
description: The Emmaus South Wales Library of Things is a new low-cost borrowing initiative which aims to help people borrow useful items they may only need for a few jobs or short amount of time. Instead of buying a new item that ends up never being used again, members can pay a small fee to borrow it, use it and return it when they’re done with it! The scheme, which is based at our Bridgend shop on Caroline Street, allows for low-cost borrowing which helps our members from all walks of life, allows people to use stuff that they don’t have space to store around their home, and promotes the idea of an environmentally-friendly circular economy where the same items get used multiple times instead of just once. All our items are priced at a recommended borrowing amount which we believe to be fair and accessible to most households. If you are feeling the squeeze on your living costs, do not hesitate to come in and we can sort out an adjusted price for you. We will work with you to make sure the price is as fair as possible. Photo I.D. and proof of address will be required for the first time you borrow. Facebook : @EmmausSWales Website: emmaus.org.uk 01656 750829 Opening Hours: Mon – Saturday, 9.30am - 4.30pm

description: Baby Bank: If you have a young family (children 5 yrs. and under) and are struggling financially, we may be able to help. We do ask for a small donation of what you can afford (at least £1.00) to help to keep the service running. We can provide you with baby essentials such as nappies, wipes, baby milk (if used) baby food, baby bubble bath, baby shampoo etc. We can also provide you with female hygiene products tampons sanitary towels, toiletries and may be able to provide you with an e-voucher for the food bank or an emergency food parcel. >https://www.spliceproject.co.uk/ Book here - https://bookwhen.com/splicefamily Facebook: @splicechild 01656 503141

description: Address: Centre of Pendeen, Church Road, Pendeen, Penzance, TR19 7SE Cornwall Area: Penwith Hub Area: Pendeen, West Penwith Hub Name: The Centre of Pendeen Opening Times: See activities Activities Offered: Mondays: 10.00 - 12.00 Parent, baby and toddler group, weekly. Contact Charlotte 07469815052 for details. 12.30 - 15.00 Community Hub (free) 'Drop-In' weekly, with refreshments and light lunches provided, scrabble, newspapers and magazines, friendly chat, sewing alterations and up-cycling assistance, occasional IT and Smartphone assistance. There will be more activities at the hub as we go into the Autumn. 18.30 - 20.00 Hatha Flow Yoga, weekly. Contact Rebecca 07907374278 or hello@rebeccayoga.org.uk for details. Tuesdays: 18.00 – 17.30 Gentle Yoga, weekly. Contact Rebecca 07907374278 or hello@rebeccayoga.org.uk for details. Wednesdays: 13.00 - 15.00 Patchwork and Craft session, on alternate weeks. 19.00 - 21.00 Short Mat Bowls. Weekly. Thursdays: 18.30 - 21.00 WI 2nd week of the monthly WI Meetings, members only. 19.30 - 20.30 1st week of the month, Women's Circle. Contact Kelly@wisdomwithin.com Fridays: 10.00 - 11.30 Book Club 3rd Friday in the month 10.00 - 11.00 Get Active exercise class, 1st, 2nd and 4th Fridays. Contact Debbie 07816255405. 11.30 - 14.00 Spinners (of wool) weekly. 16.45 - 16.30 Gardening Club 1st Fridays of the month. Saturdays: 10.00 - 13.00 WI Craft and Produce Fair and cafe, 1st Saturdays of the month. Sundays: 14.00 - 16.30 Pendeen Maids, weekly, making greetings cards for The Centre. Starting in October: Art sessions weekly on Tuesday afternoons from 10th October. IT (free) sessions every Thursday in October, morning sessions 10.30 – 12.30, afternoon sessions 13.30 - 15.30. To book a place contact The Centre on 01736 786776. Public Contact Name: Susan Horner Public Phone: 01736 786776 Public Email: Contact The Centre of Pendeen - to inquire about activities, events, if you are interested in volunteering or need assistance with access or attendance costs. description: We are a local independent space offering desks and wifi, suitable for keeping warm and getting on-line for social media and e-mails. It is a beautiful natural space with plants and a sea view, with ground level disabled access. Our space is designed to raise awareness for people to reduce carbon and increase biodiversity and encourage environmental conversation to reduce climate anxiety. There will be in real life board games too.

hours._text: Brimington Community Centre, Heywood Street, Brimington, Chesterfield, S43 1DB (main door on High Street) Thursdays 2pm to 6.30pm Warm Hub - free cuppa and biscuit, warm space to have a chat or read the paper. Brimington Lunch Club - Tuesdays 12pm (noon). Two course home-cooked lunch with hot drink at a small charge of £4 (under 12's £2); followed by a game of bingo.

Chesterfield Baptist Church, Cross Street, Chesterfield, Derbyshire, S40 4ST Wednesdays, 10am to 4pm - Renew Wellbeing Café Hot drinks, cakes and soup. Craft, jigsaws, board games, quiet space or bring your own hobby. Once a month on Saturdays 9.30am to 11am - ‘Who Let the Dads Out’ Activities for pre-schoolers, infants and Dads. Drinks and food are available. First Sunday of month 6pm to 7.30pm - Waste Not Café Cooking up surplus food donated by supermarkets into a three-course vegetarian and vegan meal. Rev. Steve Barnwell 07939 103079 / 01246 221105 www.chesterfieldbaptistchurch.org revstevecbc@gmail.com

Chesterfield Library, New Beetwell St, Chesterfield, S40 1QN The library is a warm and welcoming place to go. It can’t offer the same facilities as a ‘Warm Space’ venue but it is a place people can go to get warm and be signposted to sources of information and support if they need it.

Loundsley Green Methodist Church, 40 Pennine Way, Chesterfield, S40 4NF Starting 2 November - Wednesday 10am to 12.30pm A free warm space called ‘Welcome Wednesdays’ offering hot drinks, toast, biscuits. There are also activities such as card making, and knitting. We can offer a quiet space to read. Toys will be available for babies / toddlers. There will also be give-aways such as knitted gloves and hats. Rev Tracey Harris tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk 01246 274481

Loundsley Green Community Centre, Cuttholme Rd, Loundsley Green, Chesterfield S40 4QU Tuesdays between 10am and 1pm A free warm space offering hot drinks, biscuits and soup. There are also activities such as games and cards, and toys / books are available for children. We also offer a quiet space for anyone who may want to talk if they are feeling anxious, worried, on a one-to-one basis. We have a trained Mental Health First Aider available. Gill Carlile 2duckies@googlemail.com 07521 353467

Monkey Park Community Hub, 128a Chester Street, Brampton, Chesterfield Wednesday to Saturday, 10am to 4pm The Community Hub provides friendship and purpose. It is open to all, with ‘pay-it-forward’ free drinks, food or affordable refreshments to buy. There is also wifi available, a book swap, lots of activities and clubs. People are welcome to stay all day. Valerie Wilkinson and Simon Redding info@MonkeyPark.org.uk

St Thomas Church, Chatsworth Road, Chesterfield, S40 3AW St Thomas’ welcomes people to attend the centre to get warm whilst its activities are running. It's free to enter and you don’t have to be involved in any of the activities (although if you do and you’re struggling financially, there will be no charge for the activities). Tots group for babies, toddlers and pre-schoolers and their grown ups. Songs, Bible stories, sensory activities. Socialising for children and adults. Hot drink and biscuit included for adults. £1 per session. Kids club for children in Reception-Year 6. Friends, games, Bible, fun. £1 per session. Knit and Natter is a friendly group of people who enjoy crafts. £3.50 per session which includes refreshments. Golden Folks is an over 60’s group. There is usually a speaker or an activity. £5 per session which includes tea/coffee and cake. For men of all ages. For some meetings we take a trip out to a nearby place of interest. The cost of these visits depends on the admission price at the venue. Alternatively we meet at 1pm in the Church Centre to listen to a guest speaker – the cost then is £3 per person. Talks range over a wide variety of topics. St Thomas, Brampton church office 01246 558461 contact@stthomasbrampton.com

Staveley Edge Centre, Staveley Methodist Church, Chesterfield Road, S43 3XD Tuesday afternoon bingo Thursday afternoon free café (includes debt/housing/benefits advice), Fortnightly communion meal on a Thursday evening Monthly autism support group All opening times will include free tea / coffee, phone charging and biscuits. Tuesday 1.30 to 3pm Thursday 12.30 to 3.30pm Thursday fortnightly 6pm to 7.30pm Edge Ministries Steve Martin steve.martin@edgeministries.net

There are also activities such as jigsaw puzzles and board games, and toys are available for pre-school children. We also run a book exchange. Rev Tracey Harris tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk 01246 274481

description:
Our lounge is based in the Gallery in Emmanuel Centre.

Open every Friday 10am-5pm

Light refreshments all day, light lunch of soup and roll, (Rolls, wraps, fillings in the summer months).

 Time to chat, read a newspaper, just sit, do a puzzle, different hobbies and craft, meet new people or be on your own in a quiet reflective space to be still or pray. 

Everyone welcome. Pop in for a quick drink/chat or come and stay as long as you wish

title: Men in Sheds Carlton

address: The Stores Building, The Stores Building, Nottingham Road, Daybrook, Nottingham, NG5 6LU
description:
£3 per session. Men in Sheds supports older men in search of a hobby and those who want to socialise, share and learn new skills all in the welcoming setting of a workshop.
Equipment and tools are provided and volunteers are there for support. Members take part in the day-to-day running of the shed and decide on activities they want to follow including woodworking, skills sharing and socialising.

hours._text:

Thursdays are a mixed session for women and men over 50.

description: @Flo's - The Place in the Park. Pay-As-You-Can on Mondays From 12-2pm on Mondays our normal menu is suspended and instead we will be serving a delicious hot lunch, sweet treat and hot and cold drinks on a “pay what you can basis”. There is no judgement and how much you pay is anonymous- everyone is welcome! The café is open the rest of the time from 10am until 4pm serving delicious brunch, hot lunch specials, sandwiches, salads, and sweets, expertly roasted coffee. All the money spent at the café feeds into the local economy and funds our community activities at Flo’s. Pay-as-you-can Mondays are part of the OX4 Food Crew- a partnership of local organisations working to tackle food inequality in OX4.

hours._text: @Flo's - The Place in the Park. Pay-As-You-Can on Mondays From 12-2pm on Mondays our normal menu is suspended and instead we will be serving a delicious hot lunch, sweet treat and hot and cold drinks on a “pay what you can basis”. There is no judgement and how much you pay is anonymous- everyone is welcome! The café is open the rest of the time from 10am until 4pm serving delicious brunch, hot lunch specials, sandwiches, salads, and sweets, expertly roasted coffee. All the money spent at the café feeds into the local economy and funds our community activities at Flo’s. Pay-as-you-can Mondays are part of the OX4 Food Crew- a partnership of local organisations working to tackle food inequality in OX4.

description: Weston Park Museum tells the stories of Sheffield and its people, from pre-history to present day. You can enjoy a warm welcome and explore free exhibitions and displays, alongside a programme of talks, tours and events. Originally opened in 1875, Weston Park Museum has found lifelong fans in younger visitors and grown-ups alike for nearly 150 years. You’ll discover everything from archaeological treasures to zoological wonders, meet visitor favourites Spike the Woolly Rhino and Snowy the Polar Bear, and find out more about the people and events that shaped the city we know today. It's also home to a programme of changing exhibitions and events for all ages. In the Picturing Sheffield gallery, you'll see Sheffield-themed highlights from the city’s art collection, including work by Pete McKee, Jo Peel, Stanley Royle, Joe Scarborough, and Emilie Taylor, as well as John Singer Sargent’s much-loved The Misses Vickers. You can explore life in Ancient Egypt and unearth amazing artefacts spanning centuries in the Beneath Your Feet gallery. Over in What On Earth, you'll find out more about the city's changing wildlife and environment. In Sheffield Stories and Sheffield Life & Times, you'll discover the people and events that shaped the city and how life in Sheffield has changed over the years. There's also a café, Ambulo, on site which is open Tuesday-Sunday.
title: Weston Park Museum

address: Arundel Gate, Sheffield, S1 2PP
description: The Millennium Gallery brings the best in art and design to Sheffield The gallery’s changing exhibition programme showcases the best in national and international art and design alongside the region’s remarkable creative talents. You’ll also find collection displays celebrating Sheffield’s metalworking prowess and the remarkable art and artefacts brought to the city by the artist and writer, John Ruskin. Sheffield’s Metalwork Collection is one of the finest in the world. You’ll see over 800 examples of the cutlery, flatware and tableware that have made the city famous, as well as beautiful objects collected from every continent. The gallery is also home to the Guild of St George’s unique Ruskin Collection. Spanning art, illustrated manuscripts and minerals, the collection was established in the 1800s to inspire the people of Sheffield. Today, it’s showcased through regularly changing displays celebrating the contemporary relevance of Ruskin’s visionary ideas. There's also a café, Ambulo, on site which is open Tuesday-Sunday.
title: Millennium Gallery

address: Alma Street, Sheffield, S3 8RY
description:
Kelham Island Museum celebrates 300 years of Sheffield making history Explore the story of making in the city, from master craftsmen to mass production. Experience life and work during the Industrial Revolution, follow the sights and sounds of progress through the Victorian era, celebrate the Women of Steel and see how industry forged the modern city. You’ll hear the roar and feel the rumble of the mighty River Don Engine, the 425 ton 12,000hp visitor-favourite in steam twice a day Thursday-Sunday, and find out more about the industry that saw Sheffield become world-renowned for making and innovation. During your visit you'll have a chance to: - See the pioneering Sheffield Simplex cars and more in the Transport Galleries
- Step back in time as you stroll along the cobbles of Little Mesters Street
- Explore the Hawley Tool Collection, chronicling centuries of skilled craftsmanship and precision manufacturing
- See the Crossley Gas Engine and Die-Sinkers Workshop in action
- Find out about life on the home front in Sheffield in the 1916 House There's also a cafe on site.
title: Kelham Island Museum

description: About the charity: B:friend is a charity combatting loneliness & social isolation experienced by older neighbours (people aged 65 and over) in South Yorkshire and NE Derbyshire through 1:1 community befriending and Social Clubs. Our Gleadless Social Club, currently our only club in Sheffield, launched in 2022. The weekly b:friend Social Club aims to boost the wellbeing and meaningful community connections for older neighbours in the area. We serve refreshments and have a different stimulating and fun activity every week based on the Five Ways to Wellbeing. Our past sessions included making no-bake treats, age-friendly boxing, armchair travels, drumming, seated dancing, murder mystery games, crafts, quizzes, and much more. No boring bingo - we know we can offer much more to our older neighbours.

A free partnership session run by Swansea Council's Ageing Well Team, National Waterfront Museum and the Action For Elders Charity. ; Free wifi; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Disabled parking; Refreshments available; warm soup and bread rolls is provided at the halfway point of the film along with tea and coffee before, during and after the film is available, all free; ; Drinking water available; Visitors welcome to bring own food / drinks; Television; Advice, information and signposting; staff are on hand to help with advice and guidance and can let you know about the weekly Ageing Well activities taking place across Swansea; we run a number of weekly engagement and wellbeing sessions throughout the week and can sign post people to various support sessions that they are running including social walks, tea and chat sessions, LGBTQ+ sessions, bowling and one-off activities. On arrival, you will be met by one of friendly staff and volunteers who will guide you to the sign in sheet. Everyone is welcome to our space and can use it as frequently as they would like. , (We unfortunately do not have wheelchair access however. description: Monday to Friday, 9.00am - 5.00pm A community hub for Chinese ethnic minority, including migrant, BNO, asylum seekers, any members who are new to Swansea. We are currently operating a drop-in service providing core services such as language services in Mandarin, Cantonese and English, alongside advocacy, information service and case referral. The multicultural hub at the Grand Theatre is a friendly and non-judgemental open place. Visitors can have open conversation with local minority charity organisation and ethnic communities. We would like to create a Swansea Space that allows different background and culture people have opportunity integrate and interaction with local minority communities. ; Free wifi; Free charging points for phones or other devices; Accessible entrance / venue; Toilets; Accessible toilets; Baby changing facilities; Free period products; Advice, information and signposting:; digital support to resolve smartphone apps issues, how to download and use an app, access online services and information; signposting to local services and information through showing how to search for these online; translate letter or information from English to Chinese language when required; ;
